name: Bara Brith
description: A traditional Welsh tea bread, Bara Brith translates to 'speckled bread' due to the rich mixture of dried fruits and spices within. It is customarily served sliced and buttered.
steps: Soak dried fruits in hot tea the night before baking to plump them up.
Mix flour, sugar, and spices in a bowl.
Add the soaked fruits with any remaining tea, followed by an egg, and mix to form a dough.
Pour the batter into a greased loaf pan.
Bake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 1.5 hours until risen and golden.
Cool in the pan, then turn out onto a wire rack.
ingredients: 300 grams mixed dried fruit (raisins, currants, sultanas)
tips: Ensure the fruit is well-soaked to prevent it from drawing moisture from the dough.
Test the loaf with a skewer to ensure it's fully baked through.
Bara Brith can be stored for several days and improves in flavor.
